text.p: These are the leading stories in the Zambian press on Tuesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- An alliance of seven political parties which have agreed to field one presidential candidate are to decide whether or not to participate in elections set for November 18. Chairman of the alliance, Rodger Chongwe said it could decide to boycott the elections if the government insisted on using new electoral laws that ban some candidates from standing.
- The Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa (COMESA) has reduced tariffs by 70 percent to enable free and competitive trade, deputy trade minister Alfred Lienda said.
- The Elections Office has set October 25 to October 28 as dates for the nomination of presidential and parliamentary candidates ahead of elections set for November 18.
- Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines (ZCCM) on Monday used armed police to forcibly compel miners intending to strike to work.
